channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Kirk Shooting Suspect Held ‘Leftist Ideology,’ Utah Governor Says
item.description: Gov. Spencer Cox said the suspect had been “radicalized” but did not go into specifics about the suspect’s views.

item.title: Kathy Hochul: Why I Am Endorsing Zohran Mamdani
item.description: I am confident that Mamdani has the courage, urgency and optimism New York City needs to lead it through the challenges of this moment.

item.title: Protests Against an Israeli Cycling Team Shut Down a Major Race
item.description: The final day of the three-week long Vuelta a España came to a premature end as pro-Palestinian protesters blocked streets.

item.title: Hochul Endorses Mamdani for Mayor of New York
item.description: Gov. Kathy Hochul of New York backed Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee for mayor, in a New York Times essay. Her support comes as Democrats are s...

item.title: Emmy Awards Winners 2025: Updating List
item.description: The list of winners for the 77th Emmy Awards.

item.title: After his ICE agents arrested hundreds of South Korean workers, Trump says he doesn’t want to ‘frighten off’ foreign investment in the U.S.
item.description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung called the raid "bewildering" and warned Thursday that the raid could discourage future investment.

item.title: Trump’s State Visit Will be Biggest UK Security Operation Since Coronation
item.description: The fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk has intensified consideration about potential threats, experts said. British authorities had already made extensive...

item.title: Protests Against an Israeli Cycling Team Shut Down a Major Race
item.description: The final day of the three-week long Vuelta a España came to a premature end as pro-Palestinian protesters blocked streets.

item.title: Nonprofit Gets Two Paintings Stolen by Nazis Pulled From Auction
item.description: The paintings were among more than 300 works seized during World War II from Adolphe Schloss, a German Jew who lived in France and amassed a collectio...

item.title: This housing data is the ‘most critical economic variable’ for predicting recessions, and it’s now at the lowest level since pandemic shutdowns
item.description: Moody’s own leading economic indicator that uses machine learning has estimated the odds of a recession in the next 12 months are now at 48%.

item.title: Just days before the Fed meeting, Trump continues push to oust Lisa Cook despite new evidence that undermines his claims
item.description: Sunday’s filing is the latest step in an unprecedented effort by the White House to shape the historically independent Fed.

item.title: The Federal Reserve is about to have an extremely awkward meeting
item.description: While there is little doubt about the outcome of the Fed meeting, there are still questions over who exactly will be voting.

item.title: North Korean hackers used ChatGPT to help forge deepfake ID
item.description: Attackers used the artificial intelligence tool to craft a fake draft of a South Korean military identification card.

item.title: ​Kim Seongmin, Defector Who Pierced North Korea by Radio, Dies at 63
item.description: As a military propagandist, he fled the North by jumping off a train. In the South, he broadcast forbidden outside news to isolated North Koreans.

item.title: What Malnutrition Has Done to Gaza’s Children
item.description: The enclave is experiencing some of the highest levels of malnutrition since the fighting began. Even children who recover will carry the physical con...
